nodes.bodyText: I don't think this is the ideal way of assigning a default value. It might be better/safer to do this in the function (or sql query) where we generate/map the actual data. Our models should be just a simple representation of the data without any initialization logic.

nodes.bodyText: @kalletlak might be good to add some tests here for groups with no alterations if possible? Or otherwise maybe file an issue that we need a E2E test for it? I'm not sure how our suite of current group comparison e2e tests is looking, maybe we can easily add this one?

beforeCommit.message: Enrichments: Fix profiled cases count for groups with no alterations

afterCommit.message: Enrichments: Fix profiled cases count for groups with no alterations

nodes.bodyText: there should be a space between "if" and the open parenthesis

Wouldn't it be simpler to represent this as Set<Integer> genesWithAlteration?
also .. two spaces after =

Here we add back into the response those genes which had no mutation events anywhere .. but which were present in some panel that was used in the profiles for this study (meaning ... at least one sample was profiled for that gene)
This will recover the records in the cbioportal mutation table which say "gene X was profiled and zero mutations were found"
